page.title: 07Health&Care in the Community
page.content: Goudhurst is a healthy area with more people over the age of 60 than the average village, and an unusually high number over 75. The majority of these are caring for themselves. There is no old people's home nearby. The closest one is Hartley House in Cranbrook. One Doctor has his surgery in Goudhurst and runs a 'well-baby' clinic. In the church hall a Child Health Clinic with a health visitor in attendance takes place once a month. There is no dentist. Mrs. Sheila Klopper organises service called Goudhurst Ready-Call which is a good neighbour scheme with a team of volunteers ready to help in any way - transport for hospital visits or emergencies, sitting on helping with the elderly or children, and any social need. The village is seen to be a caring one and many have benefitted from their help.
